title.narrative: South Sudan Concept Note: Addressing the protection needs of persons with specific needs

description.narrative:
This project targets 28,552 affected people residing in the highly food insecure locations of Akobo and Pibor area. Persons with specific needs such as disabled people, children, separated children, the elderly, pregnant women, and lactating mothers are at a heightened protection risk. The compounded effects of man-made and natural disasters have seriously affected the most vulnerable internally displaced persons, refugee returnees and South Sudanese communities in these two areas, exposing them to deplorable conditions with heightened protection risks including psychosocial distress; physical safety, security concerns including GBV incidents; unaccompanied and separated children; community tensions; damage to housing, land, and property; increased use of negative coping strategies; and decreased access to education services. The IDPs face multifaceted protection concerns, hence the need for a general protection response in addition to specific GBV engagements.
The project also ensures gender, age and diversity mainstreaming throughout activities, including sex and age disaggregated data, inclusive and participatory consultations, identification, and referral of PSN to available multi-sectoral services, and direct assistance.
